title: Recipient name is not shown when scanning QR code to send transaction from wallet
body:
### Description

*Type*: Bug


*Summary*: Only recipientâ€™s address shown in the Recipient field when scanning QR code of the request from wallet

#### Expected behavior
Recipient name is shown in the Recipient field
![2018-01-03 18 14 13](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29711298/34531502-325e197a-f0bb-11e7-983c-4cb04605c4aa.jpg)


#### Actual behavior
Recipient address is not shown in the Recipient field
![2018-01-03 19 15 45](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29711298/34531364-b17f44e6-f0ba-11e7-8ca7-437716ade16b.jpg)




### Reproduction
As user A:

1. Open Status app
2. Add user B as a contact
3. Click Wallet button
4. Click Request button
5. Enter valid number to amount input

As user B:

1. Open Status app
2. Click Wallet button
3. Click Send button
4. Click Choose Recipient
5. Scan QR code from user A screen


### Additional Information
Status version: 0.9.12+
Operating System user A: Emulator Google Nexus 5, Android 6.0.0
Operating System user B: Real device OnePlus A5000, Android 7.1.1

Same happens in iOS app (0.9.12, TestFlight). Note that the same recipient name is shown in Unsigned Transactions screen when the transaction has been unsigned:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7532782/34745940-885d2452-f592-11e7-98ca-f23676bba563.png)

Checked on the latest nightly build: [Android](http://artifacts.status.im:8081/artifactory/nightlies-local/im.status.ethereum-4aaf0b-n-fl.apk), [iOS](https://i.diawi.com/mQPY3y) - the bug is still reproducible
@yevh-berdnyk can we close here?
@andytudhope no, the issue is still exists on both Android and iOS

Issue Status: 1. **Open** 2. Started 3. Submitted 4. Done
